intro: Psychotria andramontaensis, commonly known as the Andramonta psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
